WorkItem.Description:
Hi,

I have used the following code many times in many projects.

```
$objPHPExcel->getActiveSheet()->getStyle('A6:I6')->getFill() ->setFillType(PHPExcel_Style_Fill::FILL_SOLID) ->getStartColor()->setRGB('ff0000');
```

It has always worked fine, today I am trying to use it with the following hex code a87ac6, this should be a shade of purple, however it is appearing grey.

```
$objPHPExcel->getActiveSheet()->getStyle('D17')->getFill() ->setFillType(PHPExcel_Style_Fill::FILL_SOLID) ->getStartColor()->setRGB('a87ac6');
```

is this a bug?

issue occurring on excel 2008 for Mac

Comments.Message:
I've tried to replicate this, and am seeing purple fill with that specific colour.

The only suggestion I can offer is that there might be some invisible character in your colour value string that won't throw any kind of exception but that can "change" the colour
